title: There are two types of Nemesis Draft Games:
body:
1. You get a really weird mismatched team. Your teammates talk it out, figure out who's going to build what, and what lanes people are going to be in. There is a lot of fun offmeta builds, and win or lose you all had a pretty decent time.

2. You get a really weird mismatched team. Your teammates refuse to chat in lobby, only to go into the game to find that 3 people were expecting to be top. They all build the recommended build path, and complain the entire game that they didn't get the champion they liked. Win or lose, you have a horrible time.

replies.body: You forgot match type 3: the one where the enemies give you an actual team comp for whatever reason.

Yep, the enemy team gave us Morgana, Poppy, Taric, Janna and Thresh. We gave them all squishy utility supports, and I'm a Morgana main.

"Slaughter" doesn't really quite convey what happened.
You put the laughter back in slaughter

As a fellow Morgana main, I cannot fathom giving somebody her in this mode. I mean, they'll do anything (I've had the enemy team give my team Yasuo/Malphite at one point), I just can't comprehend the mindset.
I'd say either masochism or making yourself a kind of challenge: "let's see if we can win against this superior team comp with the shitiest composition enemies can possibly give us".
You would think so, but no, there are genuinely people that think 'this is the worst possible champion I could give them'. "Morgana does no damage", "useless support". It's so funny.

did you have a hard time in lane then ? or was it alright ?

Janna has a built in ad steroid on her e, and extra move speed from her w. She hence wins the majority of trades between the shield and extra ad, and once she's ahead she can outrun most typical adcs to secure kills.

As far as off-meta adc's go, Janna is a pretty strong choice. I went 28/6/11 as adc janna myself when someone finally gave me janna, but people keep thinking janna is weak for some reason and banning her.
We destroyed lane because we gave them all melee champs.

Nemesis is bundles of fun when I get to play a champ in an off meta role, but it is somewhat frustrating when people don't stick to a plan for enemy picks (e.g. all ad or all ap, and then you inevitably get 4 ad/ap and 1 ap/ad since it's better to give them a 'weak' champ).

I'm always somewhat annoyed that in about 50% of my matches so far I've found myself playing a champion in it's meta role. I like dominating as janna adc, but I've only had the opportunity to do so once so far. >.<
